body: Slow growing problems I judge dog food based on a few different points: how it affects our dog's poop (odor, solid or not, etc); to what extent it increases her hyperactivity; how willingly she eats it; and how well it satisfies her appetite. HOWEVER, she began eating garbage, the grosser, the better, and trying to eat grass. This new behavior has grown into a seriously disgusting problem. I had already decided to switch brands when the last order arrived so I began feeding it to her while deciding which brand to go/return to. body: Doggies love this! My babies love this food!  One of my dogs was having allergy issues and constantly chewing on her paws, so the vet recommended trying a grain free food with no artificial junk like coloring ( let’s be real here... dogs don’t see color the way we do and don’t care about the color of the food...lol!), artificial flavor, or preservatives. Where I live quality food is hard to find and very expensive as well, so the dogs had been getting whatever I could come across... some foods they liked and some they didn’t, and I also had the challenge of having to get separate food for the puppy. He always wanted the adult dog food and the adult dogs always wanted his. Our problems are solved with this dog food because all of the dogs absolutely love it, the allergy issues stopped, and I get the Salmon, pumpkin, and sweet potato variety which is for dogs of all life stages.  A couple more things I like about this food is that their stools are a lot firmer so there is no more mushy poop to clean up, they have less smelly gas, the price is as good if not better than buying it at a brick and mortar store, and now my dogs associate the delivery guy with yummy food and greet him nicely at the door rather than trying to kill him...lol!

body: GRAIN FREE FOOD CAUSES DCM IN DOGS, DO NOT BUY! I have been feeding my four year old golden retriever this food all her life, and I recently took her to the vet as she collapsed in the kitchen randomly. Based on everything I told the vet, I was informed that my dog has dilated cardiomyopathy, which is an enlargement of the heart ventricles and thinning of the ventricle walls. The vet said this condition is directly correlated with grain-free diets.I’ve been feeding Sasha grain free her whole life thinking it was healthier but turns out it’s the opposite 😓❗️Just wanted to help anyone who might not be aware of how bad grain-free dog food is, but if you or anyone you know is using it, stop immediately and switch to purina or something❗️

body: This recipe has all natural ingredients that my dog loves. I was searching frantically for a dog food with healthy ingredients. My Beagle/mix was having severe problems wth yeast infection He smelled awful, and scratched all the time. Even though he was taking Vet prescribed flea/tick medicine - his scratching was continuous. I took him back to the Vet for the stinky, itchy problem, because I thought he had mange He diagnosed him as having yeast. Well, I gave him the itch medicine, along with the antibiotic for about 2 weeks. He did stop stinking and itching, but I knew it wouldn't last long. The antibiotics help, but it doesn't get to the root of tbe problem. I had been doing research and found that he had a "gut" issue. I found out that his diet was the reason the yeast kept coming back.  I had to get rid of all the fillers, such as potatoes, corn, gluten, wheat, grains, soy, and fillers. I found this dog food, and decided to give it a try. He loves the taste, and he is no longer itching and scratching. I'm so glad to have found this product.  This, along with medicated shampoo and raw treats has practically alleviated all his symptoms. Now, he won't have to stay on antibiotics - which were killing his gut flora. I will be buying more.

body: Low expectations but pleasantly surprised! I bought a small bag of this as a hold over until my dog's normal food arrives; while I have no plans on switching to this food permanently as I prefer a food rotation which consists of rotating through a handful of formulas from a few brands, my dog loved this! Like many dogs, she likes new food better than food she is used to since it's a novelty; but she was especially excited about this, even given that. I had never tried this brand before, and had considered it a very average food; but now that I see how much she likes it I may rotate this brand in with her normal food rotation now and then since the ingredients are acceptable, even though it's not as "fancy" as what she usually gets. I can't comment on the long term effects of this food, but if you have a picky eater it may be worth a try!

body: My dog wouldn't eat it! I have a dog that eats just about everything, due to some time spent on the streets before Rescue picked him up.  He likes bananas, Rice a Roni, canned peas, and nearly every dog food we put in front of him.  This bag was small, so we took it with us on a road trip a couple of hundred miles away to see Grandma.He wouldn't eat it.  He would pick up a mouthful of the food and spit it on the floor, over and over, until I stopped him.  I managed to get some other dog food, and put it in front of him -- voila he loved it!  So, the next day, I mixed the new dog food with this Lamb dog food.  Little dog outsmarted me:  he ate the second dog food, and spit out the Nature's Recipe!I am not a complete fool, so I dropped off the remainder of the food at the shelter (they know me, otherwise they don't take open bags). So I had to give the flavor of the food a one. (It gets a one from the dog.  I am not going to taste it myself to see if the flavor is yummy!)If you can't get a dog to eat it, it could be the healthiest dog food on Earth, and it wouldn't do any good.  I suggest you try the smallest container of it that you can find and see if your dog is as finicky as mine.

body: This stuff is dangerous!! My dog got violently ill on this food. I thought for a while he was just being fussy when he didn’t want to eat it. I would wait when he got hungry enough to eat he would scarf it down. Turns out he was trying to tell me something. His liver became inflamed, so inflamed in fact that he began vomiting violently for two days and diarrhea, at one point he was bleeding from his rectum. I rushed him to the nearest animal hospital and paid $1000 to have an ultrasound and bloodwork done STAT in the animal hospital ER only to find out that while his health had been just fine, his liver was severely inflammed and he was dehydrated to the point of critical condition. The first thing they asked me was what are you feeding him? I was told that if he survives at all I am to IMMEDIATELY stop feeding him this food. I will now need to seek alternative (and expensive) food that will be gentle on his compromised liver for the rest of his life and will possibly need a prescription to help his liver heal and function as well as can be. OUTRAGEOUS that this food was originally recommended to me by a trusted pet supply store and still being sold everywhere!!! Please read labels and protect your pet. Don’t do what I did. Watch your pets and listen to them when they try to tell you they don’t want to eat their food, it’s for a reason!!
